intro: Gagnebina bakoliae, commonly known as the Bakoliae gagnebina, is a rare flowering plant native to the humid forests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
